page.title: 14PLODDY HOUSE
page.content: PLODDY HOUSE (CONT FROM PAGE 13) The land owned by Mr.Davison is capable of growing only certain crops, so they grow potatoes, sugar-beet and wheat. They sell their crops to merchants except for the sugar-beet which is sold to sugar-beet factories where it is made into sugar. The price they get for the sugar-beet depends upon the sugar content of the beet. Whereas the price for their cereals doesn't vary that much because the European Economic Community maintains a minimum selling price to the farmers. To maximize yields fertilizers and pesticides are used although generally in small amounts. The reason being that they are expensive to buy and also to avoid pollution of the local water courses.
